    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public <T extends java.lang.Number> Matrix<T> getInstance(java.lang.Class<? extends Matrix> matrixClass,
                                                          int numberOfRows,
                                                          int numberOfColumns)
                                                   throws MatrixException
        Description copied from interface: MatrixFactory
        Create a matrix that is an instance of the same class as the parameter object, with the given matrix size.
        Specified by:
        getInstance in interface MatrixFactory
        Parameters:
        matrixClass - A class object used to determine the class of the matrix to instantiate
        numberOfRows - The number of rows in the new matrix.
        numberOfColumns - The number of columns in the new matrix.
        Returns:
        The new matrix.
        Throws:
        MatrixException - If the class is not recognised as one from which a matrix object can be created or if an attempt is made to create a matrix with an invalid size.

      • getInstance

        public <T extends java.lang.Number> Matrix<T> getInstance(java.lang.Class<? extends Matrix> matrixClass,
                                                          T[][] contents)
                                                   throws MatrixException
        Description copied from interface: MatrixFactory
        Create a matrix that is an instance of the same class as the parameter object, with the given content. The matrix size is determined from the content provided.
        Specified by:
        getInstance in interface MatrixFactory
        Parameters:
        matrixClass - A class object used to determine the class of the matrix to instantiate.
        contents - The contents of the new matrix.
        Returns:
        The new matrix.
        Throws:
        MatrixException - If the class is not recognised as one from which a matrix object can be created or if an attempt is made to create a matrix with an invalid size.
